tsRNN 0.1.4
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Timeseries data preparation for neural network Keras models

Source: R/ts_nn_preparation.R
ts_nn_preparation.Rd

The following steps are proceeded:

  • Split in train, validation and test split

  • Transformation to 3D arrays for Keras

ts_nn_preparation(data, tsteps, length_val = 16L, length_test = 8L)

Arguments

data

balanced univariate time series as data.table object. Lagged columns in the form value_lagX required, where X represents number of lag
tsteps

number of lagged time steps
length_val

length of validation set
length_test

length of test set

Value

list of "X" and "Y" each containing "train", "val" and "test" arrays

Examples

data <- tsRNN::DT_unh

data[, value_lag1 := data.table::shift(value, type = "lag", n = 1)]

#>           index    value value_lag1
#>   1: 1990-09-28   14.356         NA
#>   2: 1990-12-31   15.872     14.356
#>   3: 1991-03-28   24.016     15.872
#>   4: 1991-06-28   28.069     24.016
#>   5: 1991-09-30   30.264     28.069
#>  ---                               
#> 116: 2019-06-28 4744.000   4832.000
#> 117: 2019-09-30 5014.000   4744.000
#> 118: 2019-12-31 5095.000   5014.000
#> 119: 2020-03-31 4996.000   5095.000
#> 120: 2020-06-30 9241.000   4996.000
data[, value_lag2 := data.table::shift(value, type = "lag", n = 2)]

#>           index    value value_lag1 value_lag2
#>   1: 1990-09-28   14.356         NA         NA
#>   2: 1990-12-31   15.872     14.356         NA
#>   3: 1991-03-28   24.016     15.872     14.356
#>   4: 1991-06-28   28.069     24.016     15.872
#>   5: 1991-09-30   30.264     28.069     24.016
#>  ---                                          
#> 116: 2019-06-28 4744.000   4832.000   4497.000
#> 117: 2019-09-30 5014.000   4744.000   4832.000
#> 118: 2019-12-31 5095.000   5014.000   4744.000
#> 119: 2020-03-31 4996.000   5095.000   5014.000
#> 120: 2020-06-30 9241.000   4996.000   5095.000
data <- data[!is.na(get(paste0("value_lag2")))]

ts_nn_preparation(data, tsteps = 2L, length_val = 6L, length_test = 6L)
